Button.short_desc: A control that responds to user input and raises a Click event.
Button.long_desc: The Button control provides a Click event to respond to user input from a touch, mouse, keyboard, stylus, or other input device. You can put different kinds of content in a button, such as text or an image, or you can restyle a button to give it a new look.

text_content.title: A simple Button with text content.

large_content.title: Wrapping Buttons with large content.
large_content.content: This is some text that is too long and will get cut off

DropDownButton.short_desc: A button that displays a flyout of choices when clicked.
DropDownButton.long_desc: A control that drops down a flyout of choices from which one can be chosen.

HyperlinkButton.short_desc: A button that appears as hyperlink text, and can navigate to a URI or handle a Click event.
HyperlinkButton.long_desc: A HyperlinkButton appears as a text hyperlink. When a user clicks it, it opens the page you specify in the child <Link> component from react-router-dom or <a> from HTML.

uri.title: A hyperlink button that navigates to a URI

ToggleButton.short_desc: A button that can be switched between two states like a CheckBox.
ToggleButton.long_desc: A ToggleButton looks like a Button, but works like a CheckBox. It typically has two states, checked (on) or unchecked (off). You can determine it's state by checking the value or defaultValue property.

simple.title: A simple ToggleButton with text content.

SplitButton.short_desc: A two-part button that displays a flyout when its secondary part is clicked.
SplitButton.long_desc: The SplitButton is a dropdown button, but with an addition execution hit target.
